Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23,24, Craylands, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Abandoned untaxed vehicle, 28th August
item.description:
Vehicle was moved from the end of Maddocks Close to the top and left on the parking apron taking up valuable residential parking spaces for those who do pay their car road tax. The vehicle is fully loaded with builder's rubble and is a fire hazard. More likely the owner will fly tip the load on the grassy area nearby, as has been the case in the past

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maddocks Close, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree branches and tree root damage, 28th August
item.description:
The problem is that the pine-like needles are strewn all over the pavement and into road and can be hazardous in wet; the tree roots have caused severe damage to the boundary wall the and pavements outside now show paving slabs raised the full depth of done slabs; mums with babes in pushchairs now walk in the road. The needles often fall onto car windscreens - interfering with windscreen wipers; and into engines cavities. This has been going on for many months. Surprised that drivers of your own road-sweeping vehicles haven’t reported this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welbeck Avenue, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous road markings, 28th August
item.description:
As you can see see in the picture the road markings on the South Eden Park Road junction with the Chinese roundabout are actually on the pavement. This is VERY danerous, especially with children using the junction and the shorter days approaching. I've also attached a couple of other junctions on the same roundabout that have been corrected marked - with road marking remaining no the ROAD and NOT on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130, South Eden Park Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New pedestrian refuge obstructing highway, 28th August
item.description:
Further to FMS report: Https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/8084186 I understand that there are concerns that the HGV delivery lorries to Sainsburys etc. may experience ‘difficulties’ negotiating this new pedestrian refuge. Especially, one can imagine with drivers unfamiliar to the area and in dark, inclement conditions….. No doubt Bromley Council have/will liaise with Sainsburys et al. to address concerns…… Photos attached taken 8am Wednesday 27 August showing double decker buses in bright conditions…. I did note one bus driver put his hazard flashers on…..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Centre Common Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree branch hanging off - dangerous!, 28th August
item.description:
A large tree branch has broken and is hanging by a thread - likely to fall very soon and would be extremely dangerous if it fell on someone, especially small children with it being so near the primary school. Needs addressing ASAP! Thank you :)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benares Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture beung dumped, 28th August
item.description:

item.title: Trees being cut down, 28th August
item.description:
Resident noticed a men chopping down mature trees and digging up the foot path –next to mobile homes – Off Watery Lane – by Crittalls Corner roundabout on the same side of DFS - B&Q he would like to know what exactly is going on they did not appear to council workers and not in worker clothing . Please can we call back to advise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watery Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet
